FuncDef:
The nat log send-mode command configures the mode of sending NAT logs.
The undo nat log send-mode command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device sends log information once a NAT session is created or deleted in the user-to network or network-to-user direction.
CLIs: undo nat log send-mode { session-start-only | session-end-only }
undo nat log send-mode { session-outbound | session-inbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables a NAT device to send logs only when sessions are created.
-

Indicates that logs are sent only when a NAT session ages out.
-

Sends logs for only user-to-public network sessions.
-

Sends logs for only public network-to-user sessions.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, a device sends log information once a NAT session is created or deleted in the user-to network or network-to-user direction. To reduce the number of session logs to be sent, run the nat log send-mode command.
Precautions
The nat log send-mode command takes effect only on VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
